intro: Hyssopus scrophulariifolius, commonly known as blue hyssop, is a perennial herb native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It is characterized by its square stems, opposite leaves, and clusters of blue or purple tubular flowers. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and borders. Its aromatic leaves and flowers are often used in traditional herbal medicine and as a source of nectar for bees. The species is closely related to other members of the mint family, Lamiaceae, and shares similar growth habits.
